title: Deck OCR Learning System - Design Provenance
body:
Design provenance chain for deck Learning System:

2. Claude proposes shadow confusion matrix + vintage detection (Issue #3)
3. Human connects to learning system concept
4. Claude drafts learning architecture (Issue #4)
5. G refines with: n-gram confusions, granular frame metadata, undo window, edit-budget gating, ranking diagnostics, simple storage
6. Human approves, requests full implementation
7. Claude implements with all refinements

title: senken.pro Server Stack Overview
body:
## senken.pro — Node/Server Stack

**What it is**: Hosted MCP server exposing Decibel project intelligence tools as APIs

**Stack**:
- Node.js + TypeScript
- MCP SDK 1.0 (JSON-RPC 2.0)
- PostgreSQL (database)
- Render.com

**Transports**:
- stdio → Claude Code
- HTTP → ChatGPT, iOS, remote

**API Surface**:
- GET /health — Uptime
- GET /tools — List tools
- POST /call — Execute any tool
- POST /api/inbox — iOS voice
- POST /mcp — Full MCP protocol

**Tool Domains**: Sentinel, Dojo, Oracle, Architect, Designer, Context, Friction, Voice

## Studio (Separate)
- Supabase-backed
- AI generation (image/3D/video)
- NOT on senken.pro

title: Deck App Integration with senken.pro
body:
## Deck (MTG Card Scanner) → senken.pro Integration

**Deck** is a Magic: The Gathering card scanner/intelligence app that integrates with the Decibel tools architecture.

### How Deck Connects

**Server**: senken.pro (Render-hosted MCP server)
**Protocol**: HTTP
**Auth**: Bearer token (if enabled)

### Key Endpoints for Deck

| Endpoint | Method | Purpose |
|----------|--------|---------|
| `/health` | GET | Health check |
| `/tools` | GET | List available tools |
| `/call` | POST | Execute any tool |

### POST /call Format
```json
{
  "tool": "tool_name",
  "arguments": { ... }
}
```

### Relevant Tool Domains for Deck
- **Sentinel** — Track issues, epics for Deck development
- **Dojo** — Experiment with new card recognition features
- **Oracle** — Get next actions, project health
- **Context** — Persist AI memory across sessions

### Stack Behind senken.pro
- Node.js + TypeScript
- MCP SDK 1.0
- PostgreSQL
- Render.com

title: Voice Inbox Sync Protocol
body:
## Voice Inbox: iOS → Supabase → Local

Human can send voice messages from iOS app. These go to **Supabase** first, NOT local files.

**To check for voice messages:**
1. Run `voice_inbox_sync` with `project_id` for the project you're working on
2. This pulls queued messages from Supabase → local `.decibel/voice/inbox/`
3. Then you can see and act on them

**Proactive check**: When starting a session on a project, consider running `voice_inbox_sync` to see if human sent any voice notes.
